meanings.definition: A device used to make a substance uniform in consistency.
meanings.sent1: The homogenizers in the lab helped mix the ingredients evenly.
meanings.sent2: The dairy factory used homogenizers to ensure the milk was smooth.
meanings.sent3: The homogenizers at the ice cream shop were on strike, causing lumpy desserts.
meanings.sent4: Her voice acted as a homogenizer, blending different opinions into one harmonious decision.
meanings.sent5: The chef's homogenizers transformed the chunky soup into a creamy delight.

meanings.definition: A person or thing that homogenizes.
meanings.sent1: The new employee was a skilled homogenizer, bringing unity to the team.
meanings.sent2: The homogenizers of society work towards creating a more cohesive community.
meanings.sent3: The homogenizers in the orchestra made sure every instrument played in harmony.
meanings.sent4: Her smile acted as a homogenizer, spreading joy and positivity to everyone around.
meanings.sent5: The teacher was a natural homogenizer, blending diverse ideas into a coherent lesson plan.
